Hi JUnit lovers,

Sorry for this intrusion but I feel you might be interested to know that
the JUnit in Action book has shipped. It's a practical book about JUnit
and its ecosystem. It's a hands-on book showing how to unit test real
life applications, using different unit testing strategies: mock
objects, stubs and Cactus for in-container testing. You'll learn not
only the reasoning behind using these techniques but also how to apply
them in practice.

Here are some useful pointers:
- Book web site: http://www.manning.com/massol/
- Table of contents:
http://www.manning.com/getpage.html?project=massol&filename=contents.htm
l
- 2 sample chapters:
http://www.manning.com/getpage.html?project=massol&filename=chapters.htm
l (chapter 7 is the one introducing mock objects)
- TheServerSide review:
http://www.theserverside.com/resources/article.jsp?l=JUnitBookReview
- JavaRanch review:
http://www.javaranch.com/bunkhouse/Miscellaneous.jsp#1930110995
- Amazon reviews: http://tinyurl.com/x37x

Thanks
-Vincent
JUnit in Action author
